TPS is excited to announce the addition of several staff members to our school. Over the next few weeks we'll be posting introductions from them so you can get to know them better.

The Wonderful 2nd Grade Teacher Ms. Homan....
I am so excited to join the Truman community this year as the new 2nd grade teacher! I am originally from Mankato, and I attended Mankato Loyola. I graduated from Saint Mary's University of Minnesota in Winona in 2018, with a degree in k-6 education. After graduation I stayed in Winona and taught kindergarten for the last two years. This summer I moved to Truman in order to be closer to family! In my free time I enjoy being with family and friends, playing softball, and going on walks with my dog Ziggy!
I am so excited for a fun year in 2nd grade! During this year we will continue to improve our reading and math skills, as well as gain confidence in ourselves as learners. I can't wait to meet all of my wonderful students and help them continue to learn and grow!

Pick up in Truman will be at the school by the center glass doors right in front of the cafeteria.
Lewisville will have lunches (hot and cold) delivered in front of the library for pickup.

Please contact the school ASAP to sign up for summer lunches.

post_text:
Get excited for SUPERHERO DAY!

This coming Tuesday, April 28th, is Superhero Day at the American Heart Association. The day is all about GRATITUDE for doctors, nurses, first responders, grocery employees, your family, and so many more. Not all superheroes wear capes!

Get together with your family or with friends virtually and talk about the best way to celebrate your personal superheroes!
We have created fun social media photo frames for your families, teachers and community to use. https://www2.heart.org/site/SPageServer?pagename=khc_resources_superhero_frames

This can be someone in your community or a family member. Share your idea with the hashtag #NationalSuperHeroesDay.

Here are some ideas:
Thank you to all the doctors, police officers and everyone helping other people right now
My daddy is a hero, he’s helping keep us safe
My doctor is a hero, she’s making sure we can all be healthy
Thank you everybody for the hard work you do every day
We wouldn’t be here without you.

EVERYBODY who is helping, I just want to say thank you.
We hope you can join in on April 28!
